portion of the contents will be as follows;
l. TALES, original and selected; ESSAYS,

al and selected from the best American and For

ES of distinguished persons, male and tematc,

ouarto COpPER-PLATE ENGRAVING, fitted

. cent Of Mont Blanc. Cascade near oysans, Dau
phny. Desert of the Grand Chartreuse. Eas

via, Spain. Lake Of Killarney from Kenmur
Park.

A friend in Charlestown has given us the
following recipe, which he says he has
known to effect cure Of the ring worm N
yery obstinate cascs:-Take half pint tun-
bier, and fill it nearly full of strong vinegar
then put in new laid egg, ohe newer
the better)-let the egg remain few days
till the vinegar eats the shell entirely off
then throw away the egg, and apply the vin-
egar, thus prepared, to the part AFFECTED.
once day, for week or ten days. winch
will effect cure. During the application, Y
is necessary to keep the bowels open by salts
or some gentle medicine
Cure for The Ring Worm.

one day in the Zenanah, in Persia, when she
observed one Of the Princes, boy ten years
of age, with his handkerchief tied ose, his
!, eyes, grouping about the apartment. Cpon
Sinquirng what he was doing, he said that as
he knew that when the Shah his father died
ne should have his eyes put out, he was now
crying how he could do without them

/. 'This work is intended as an agreeable and IN
structye companion for the pa lour, and an aP-

No exertion will be spared to render 1.-THE
SOUVENIR" in all respects, worthy the patron
age fthe public, both as cheap and elegant
emporium Of useful and interesting information,
and a valuable repository OF choice specimens o.
Miscellaneous literature. Strict attention Will
be bestowed on the moral tendency OF "filE I
SOUVENIR and constant watchtulness pre-
served over the cause and interests OF virtue.


portion of the contents will be as follows;
l. TALES, original and selected; ESSAYS,
moral humorous and scientific POETRY, origin
al and selected from the best American and For
cign publications; BIOGRAPHICAL SKETCH
ES of distinguished persons, male and tematc,
particularly the latter; ANECDOTES, Bon WoiS,
&c sc. The original matter necessary for this
department of our paper will be furnished by
individuals who are advantageously known to
the public through the medium Of their Iitera
nv productions; besides the numerous CO res
pondents who may be expected to contribute
IT. MlSCELLANY.-Inter items of in
tellirence, foreign and domestic occurrences,
deaths, marriages, &c.


III. FNGRAVINGS.-The first number Of
every month will be embellished with a splendid
ouarto COpPER-PLATE ENGRAVING, fitted
to the size Of the work, among which will De the
following:


Alhanbra. Ancient Palace of the Moorlsi
Kings in Spain. View ofthe Permanent bridge
over the Shuylkill. Etna, from the Gardens
the Prince of Bscaria. View of Petersburgh :
Arch Street Ferry, Philadelphia. Paraclete
founded by Abelard Giants Causeway ant
Bridge of Bridoh. State Prison, Auburn New
York. Tynwald Hill, Isle of Man. Burning
Fountain. one Of the seven wonders of Dauphiny

Gard, near Nismes, Languedoc. saussure's as
. cent Of Mont Blanc. Cascade near oysans, Dau
phny. Desert of the Grand Chartreuse. Eas
Prospect of Giants Causeway. Castle OF sege
via, Spain. Lake Of Killarney from Kenmur
Park.


Each subscriber will be furnished yearly wit
seventeen superior Copper-plate Engravings
the price of which ifpurchased singly would b
more than double the annual cost Of the entir
work.

full articles.headline: Cure for The Ring Worm.
full articles.article:
A friend in Charlestown has given us the
following recipe, which he says he has
known to effect cure Of the ring worm N
yery obstinate cascs:-Take half pint tun-
bier, and fill it nearly full of strong vinegar
then put in new laid egg, ohe newer
the better)-let the egg remain few days
till the vinegar eats the shell entirely off
then throw away the egg, and apply the vin-
egar, thus prepared, to the part AFFECTED.
once day, for week or ten days. winch
will effect cure. During the application, Y
is necessary to keep the bowels open by salts
or some gentle medicine

Eastern De&aonsm.-"The lady Of DR..
Marneil, the physician to the mission was
one day in the Zenanah, in Persia, when she
observed one Of the Princes, boy ten years
of age, with his handkerchief tied ose, his
!, eyes, grouping about the apartment. Cpon
Sinquirng what he was doing, he said that as
he knew that when the Shah his father died
ne should have his eyes put out, he was now
crying how he could do without them
